definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: With block copolyether's forming, the cloud point lowers appreciably.
sentences.chinese: 形成嵌段使聚醚濁點明顯下降。

sentences.english: Already scholars point to troubling signs.
sentences.chinese: 已經有學者點明瞭令人不安的跡象。

sentences.english: This statement throws light on the symbolic implications of art.
sentences.chinese: 這些敘述點明瞭藝術表達的象徵性的含義。

sentences.english: At last the advantages of electric melting method is stated.
sentences.chinese: 最後點明電熔法的優點。

sentences.english: Is beneath pure heart, but it never is highlighted.
sentences.chinese: 內心是澄淨的，卻從不點明。
